meanings.definition: The plural form of helve, meaning the handle of a tool or weapon.
meanings.sent1: The blacksmith crafted sturdy helves for his new set of hammers.
meanings.sent2: The woodcutter carefully attached the helves to his axes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the helves as swings in the workshop.
meanings.sent4: The helves of the swords gleamed in the sunlight, ready for battle.
meanings.sent5: The helves of the shovels were worn smooth from years of hard work.

meanings.definition: Third person singular present of helve, meaning to provide with a handle.
meanings.sent1: He helves the tools with precision, ensuring a comfortable grip.
meanings.sent2: She always helves her knives before starting her cooking.
meanings.sent3: The robot helves itself with extendable arms, making it easier to carry things.
meanings.sent4: His words helves the audience, giving them a clear direction to follow.
meanings.sent5: The artist helves the brush, ready to create a masterpiece on canvas.
